Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • William R Spalsbury was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • William R Spalsbury was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash Bail Applied.  The remaining Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to a Mental Health Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
No contact with victim.
DNA Sample and Surcharge is WAIVED.

Count #4 was Dismissed.  Case #14TR3860 was Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF783.
Court Costs, DNA Surcharge and DNA Sample were all WAIVED.

records.addlTxt: regarding treatment
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William R Spalsbury in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 and 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 dismissed and read in.  Count 4 dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 2 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 1 year 3 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 3 months) STAYED.  Credit for 7 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution in the amount of $10,312.82 to be paid to R.L.
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.  Submit to a Mental Health assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  No contact with victim.

Count 2:
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to Count 1. STAYED. 
- 2 years Probation
- 15 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 15 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Fine of $350.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation: Same as Count 1.

CONDITION TIME: 100 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence March 13, 2015 by 12:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
